blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data defining horizontal flow barrier locations and hydraulic characteristics.

variables.name: CELLID1
variables.description: Cell identifier for the first cell adjacent to the barrier (layer, row, column for DIS; layer, cell2d for DISV; node for DISU).
variables.tooltip: Identifies the first of two adjacent cells separated by the horizontal flow barrier. The barrier is placed on the shared face between CELLID1 and CELLID2.

variables.name: CELLID2
variables.description: Cell identifier for the second cell adjacent to the barrier (layer, row, column for DIS; layer, cell2d for DISV; node for DISU).
variables.tooltip: Identifies the second of two adjacent cells separated by the horizontal flow barrier. Must be a neighbor of CELLID1.

variables.name: HYDCHR
variables.description: Hydraulic characteristic of the barrier, in units of 1/time (hydraulic conductivity divided by barrier width).
variables.tooltip: Controls the resistance to flow across the barrier. Lower values indicate more effective barriers. Computed as K_barrier / width_barrier. A value of 0 creates a complete barrier to flow. Can be changed each stress period.
